descriptions.description: Leading a cross-functional team of 7 (Front End, Back End, C#), championing two Principal Engineers to define technical governance and ensure structural consistency.
Fostered a positive engineering culture by introducing a peer-recognition 'Kudos' system in retrospectives, improving team cohesion and motivation.
Designed and implemented a comprehensive Defect Policy to standardise issue lifecycle management, ensuring accurate reporting on feature progress.

Spearheaded the implementation of the AI Case Response feature, pushing for an MVP approach that reduced time-to-market by 75%. Achieving record usage for a new feature and resulting in a change of strategy to adopt the MVP approach.
Orchestrated the urgent technical rebrand from 'FeedItBack' to '125 Data & Insights' within a strict 6-week deadline, updating all product suites and solving critical legacy theming issues.
Led the migration of all services from Bitbucket to GitHub, simultaneously modernising security practices by converting environment variables and secrets to Azure App Configuration.
Served as the Front End representative, owning architectural decisions and standardising development practices across the team.
Conducted regular 1-to-1s and formal performance reviews for Front End developers, facilitating professional growth and setting clear performance goals.

Acted as the primary Front End representative in key Agile ceremonies (4 Amigos, Refinement, Sprint Updates), ensuring technical feasibility and accurate scoping of UI requirements before development.
Delegated development tasks and enforced strict ticket readiness standards on Jira, ensuring all requirements and acceptance criteria were defined.
Finalised the internal component library (npm rollup), standardising UI elements across the product suite to ensure brand consistency and reduce development time.
Implemented a critical system update from Vue2 to Vue3 & TypeScript, resulting in an over 20% increase in application performance and accessibility.
Built a reusable component library for the FeedItBack system, hosted as a private npm package to ensure UI consistency across all front end microservices.
Developed a Storybook instance for the component library, providing a streamlined user experience for visualising and implementing new components and features.
Created a structured approach to unit tests using Vitest, achieving >85% coverage across all sections; this standard was subsequently adopted by the wider team.
Developed the company's first 'JS only' product: a client dashboard using a Vue3 UI and an Express.js/Sequelize API.
Played a lead role in the development of Mallcomm Front End, introducing structured workflows that improved plugin performance and maintainability.
Introduced a structured format of work for the development team to increase productivity and accountability.
Key involvement in implementing multi-language translations across the Mallcomm product for 10+ languages.
Implemented responsive, interactive, and accessible UI/UX designs across Drupal 7 and Drupal 8 e-commerce sites for high-profile clients (e.g., National Forest, FCA).
Utilised BEM methodology to create well-structured, reusable Front End code, increasing development speed and easing debugging.
